title: Can a minimized copy of a response to a complaint be considered served properly in bankruptcy court?
question: If the opposing counsel sent a response to a complaint minimizing 2 pages into 1 page in a bankruptcy case, can this still be considered a true and correct copy? Are there grounds to vacate a response if it is served this way?
answers: Frankly, I assume (or hope) your question is not asked in seriousness. As much as copiers can reduce to a smaller size, or duplex to utilize both sides of the paper, they can also be used to enlarge. If your does not have this capacity, a modestly priced magnifying glass would serve equally well. But bringing a motion to strike a responsive pleading based upon utilizing cost-saving reductions of 50% would be appropriately the basis for the imposition of sanctions under Rule 9011.
I changed the area of law to bankruptcy. I have seen the reduced copies before, but I am not aware of rule authorizing it. Sometimes it makes the text barely legible.
I agree with the comments given by my colleagues. You can easily enlarge the print on your photo copy machine.
